stateCompliance.headline: Understanding Payday Loan Laws in Texas
stateCompliance.content: Austin residents should understand that payday loans are legal in Texas through licensed Credit Access Businesses (CABs). While Texas has minimal state-level restrictions, Austin was one of the first Texas cities to enact local ordinances that provide extra consumer protections for Travis County residents.
keyPoints: Texas allows payday loans through licensed Credit Access Businesses (CABs) regulated by the Office of Consumer Credit Commissioner (OCCC)
There is no state cap on interest rates or CAB fees - typical APRs range from 400% to 700%+
You have the right to cancel your loan within 3 days of signing without penalty
Lenders cannot threaten criminal prosecution for non-payment (except for fraud or theft)
Your wages cannot be garnished for payday loan debt under Texas law
Your home (if declared homestead) is protected from debt collection
Always verify your lender is licensed at occc.texas.gov before borrowing
stateCompliance.regulatoryBody: Texas Office of Consumer Credit Commissioner (OCCC)

warningBox.title: Important Cost Warning
warningBox.content: Payday loans in Texas are among the most expensive in the nation. A typical $300 loan can cost over $1,000 in fees alone, resulting in APRs exceeding 700%. Consider alternatives such as credit union loans, payment plans with creditors, or nonprofit credit counseling before taking out a payday loan.

stateCompliance.disclaimer: This information is provided for general educational purposes only and should not be construed as legal advice. Payday loan laws and regulations change frequently. The information presented may not reflect the most current legal developments. For the most accurate and up-to-date information, contact the Texas Office of Consumer Credit Commissioner at (800) 538-1579 or visit occc.texas.gov. If you need legal advice, please consult with a licensed attorney in Texas.

cityOrdinance.headline: Austin City Payday Loan Protections
cityOrdinance.intro: Austin was one of the first Texas cities to enact local payday loan protections. These ordinances provide additional safeguards beyond state law:
keyProvisions: Payday loans limited to 20% of gross monthly income
Maximum 3 rollovers with 25% principal reduction each time
CABs must register with the City of Austin
Violation is Class C misdemeanor ($500 fine)

reviews.text: As a UT student, I was worried about taking out a payday loan, but Ace explained Austin's city ordinance limits and made sure I only borrowed what I could afford. Very responsible lending.
reviews.author: Kevin T.

reviews.text: Love the SoCo location - easy to get to and the staff is friendly. They were upfront about all the fees and I had cash in hand within an hour.
reviews.author: Amanda S.

reviews.text: I needed emergency funds between gigs (I'm a musician on 6th Street) and Ace came through. Fair treatment and clear terms. Austin is lucky to have responsible lenders like this.
reviews.author: Marcus B.

nearbyLocations.headline: Also Serving Nearby Cities
nearbyLocations.intro: Can't make it to our Austin location? We also serve these nearby Texas cities:

faq.question: Where is your Austin location?
faq.answer: Our Austin branch is located at 2345 South Congress Avenue, Suite 100, in the heart of SoCo near Lady Bird Lake. Take I-35 Exit 234B (Downtown) for the quickest route.

faq.question: What are your hours in Austin?
faq.answer: We're open Monday through Friday 9 AM to 7 PM, and Saturday 10 AM to 4 PM. We're closed on Sundays. Online applications are available 24/7.

faq.question: Does Austin have special payday loan rules?
faq.answer: Yes, Austin was one of the first Texas cities to pass a payday loan ordinance. Loans are limited to 20% of your gross monthly income, only 3 rollovers are allowed with 25% principal reduction each time, and lenders must register with the city.

faq.question: What do I need to bring to the Austin branch?
faq.answer: Bring a valid government-issued photo ID, proof of steady income (pay stub, bank statement, or benefits letter), your active checking account information, and a working phone number.

faq.question: How much can I borrow in Austin?
faq.answer: Under Austin's city ordinance, payday loans are limited to 20% of your gross monthly income. For example, if you earn $3,000 per month, your maximum loan would be $600.

faq.question: Can I apply online for an Austin payday loan?
faq.answer: Yes, you can start your application online 24/7 and complete the process at our Austin location or receive funds via direct deposit if approved.
